meanings.definition: To load (a vehicle, ship, container, etc.) with less than the full or proper amount of cargo or passengers.
meanings.sent1: The workers were underloading the truck with boxes of supplies.
meanings.sent2: The captain decided to underload the ship to ensure a smoother journey.
meanings.sent3: The underloading of the plane with passengers led to a comical seating arrangement.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was underloading her life with unnecessary baggage.
meanings.sent5: Underloading the car with heavy items made it easier to drive up the steep hill.

meanings.definition: The act of loading something with less than the full or proper amount of cargo or passengers.
meanings.sent1: The underloading of the truck caused delays in delivery.
meanings.sent2: The underloading of the ship was a strategic decision by the captain.
meanings.sent3: The underloading of the bus with passengers resulted in a funny game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt the underloading of information as he struggled to remember details.
meanings.sent5: The underloading of the train with cargo made it move faster along the tracks.
